p: The interactive influences of temperature anomaly and log Bt acreage significantly influenced the abundance of H. zea over the past two decades ( F 1,77 = 35.6, p < 0.001, pseudo- R 2 = 0.53; see table 1 for coefficients). Results show contrasting effects of the variables on abundance, with the effect of temperature anomaly decreasing with increasing Bt acreage. While the overall population trend was negative, abundance was highest at low Bt acreage and high-temperature anomaly ( figure 1 a).
